title: NixOS Package PRs for exfatprogs, pam_u2f, diffutils, nixos, attr-2.5.1, gnugrep-3.7 packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for exfatprogs, pam_u2f, diffutils, nixos, attr-2.5.1, gnugrep-3.7 packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Nix's version of bazel has custom patches to make bazel more hermetic when used with nix. One of those is limiting the default environment of Bash. However, this default environment is insufficient because lots of programs rely on diff being in the path like buildifier, golangci-lint, and other things since golang diff implementations aren't very good.

Ideally we'd include "diffutils" as part of this list for rules that assume the presence of "diff" and don't allow nice knobs to configure otherwise.

Furthermore, bazel has a lot of internal facilities that utilize patch (like when downloading workspaces, we have the option of patching them), so include gnupatch as well.

Fixes #249846

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: bazel_6: Add diffutils and gnupatch to initialEnvironment

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add a convenient option to install Dolphin in other desktop environment. In my case that's Hyprland and (previously) Sway.

When only the dolphin package is installed, it has broken theme, and hamburger button->Show Panels->Terminal will tell you it actually needs konsole package despite there is nothing in the UI to show this feature is broken. It is subpar compared to how dolphin is presented in a normal KDE install, and makes adapting it in other desktop environment difficult, since there is no documentation for it.

The included options are picked from my personal nixos-config, and is tested with this patch:

dolphin.patch.zip

items.title: feat: pam_u2f add user options

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR adds a option to make the files in the home recursively owned by the actual user/group this can be useful in cases where you have files in the home directory before the user exits. A example use case is described in nix-community/disko#383 where otherwise files end up getting owned by the root user.

items.title: nixos/gns3-server: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This new option, networking.wireguard.interfaces.NAME.metric, allows
increasing the metric of the routes, effectively lowering priority.

(I'm using high metric to allow having the Wireguard interface always
up, even when the client machines are on their home network. Before I
had to stop the interface when home to avoid packet routing issues.)

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR restores the ruleFile option, it can be useful if you have a nixos config that's public but you want to load usbguard rules from a secret source. Depending on your thread model this would prevent anyone to emulate a usb device with the same id, etc..

items.title: {,nixos/}rkvm: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add nixos-rebuild repl, which loads a nix repl for you.

If you use flakes, brings the flake itself into scope as well.

Apologies to the non-flake users; your repl isn't quite as fancy, but at least evaluates your config exactly as you would expect, unlike flakes which are only evaluated impurely for now.

Tested by hand, as evaluating in the sandbox is tricky.

Try it

Flake in ~/config

nix run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl --flake ~/config

Non-flake

nix --extra-experimental-features flakes\ nix-command run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl

I've tested the modules on my own nixos system.

items.title: nixos/coredns: add extraArgs option

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This is rather a strawman of a PR to try to figure out the best spot to
put this code and the documentation of how to use it. I don't really
know.

I will write a test when I have an idea of what to put in the test and where to put the test.

Sample content:

!_TAG_FILE_SORTED	1	1
!_TAG_FILE_ENCODING	utf-8	1
_module.args	/home/jade/dev/nixpkgs/lib/modules.nix	122
_module.check	/home/jade/dev/nixpkgs/lib/modules.nix	186
_module.freeformType	/home/jade/dev/nixpkgs/lib/modules.nix	193
_module.specialArgs	/home/jade/dev/nixpkgs/lib/modules.nix	209
appstream.enable	/home/jade/dev/nixpkgs/nixos/modules/config/appstream.nix	6
assertions	/home/jade/dev/nixpkgs/nixos/modules/misc/assertions.nix	9
boot.binfmt.emulatedSystems	/home/jade/dev/nixpkgs/nixos/modules/system/boot/binfmt.nix	272

Sample usage (can be used in parallel with nix-doc tags):

nix build -f nixos/release.nix optionsCtags -o opts-tags
(in vim): :set tags+=opts-tags
          :tj boot.binfmt.emulatedSystems

This PR depends on and contains #249243. Marked as draft till that's
worked out. This PR pair replaces #208173.

  • 23.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: nixos/doc: add ctags support for NixOS options
